title: With co-founders leaving and an IPO looming, Elon Musk turns talk to the moon
summary: According to The New York Times, which reports that it heard the meeting, Musk told employees that xAI needs a lunar manufacturing facility, a factory on the moon that will build AI satellites and fling them into space via a giant catapult.

title: Okay, now exactly half of xAI’s founding team has left the company
summary: Whatever the cause of the departures, the cumulative impact is alarming. There is a lot of work left to do at xAI, and an IPO will bring more scrutiny than the lab has ever faced before.

title: This Sequoia-backed lab thinks the brain is ‘the floor, not the ceiling’ for AI
summary: AI lab Flapping Airplanes just landed $180 million in seed funding from the likes of Google Ventures, Sequoia, and Index to do something most labs have quietly given up on: making models learn like humans instead of vacuuming up the internet. The founding team, made up of brothers Ben and Asher Spector and co-founder Aidan Smith, is […]

summary: Robert Playter announcd he is leaving Boston Dynamics after 30 years at the company in various roles, including six years as CEO.

title: The first signs of burnout are coming from the people who embrace AI the most
summary: Because employees could do more, work began bleeding into lunch breaks and late evenings. The employees' to-do lists expanded to fill every hour that AI freed up, and then kept going.

title: Databricks CEO says SaaS isn’t dead, but AI will soon make it irrelevant
summary: AI isn't going to replace major SaaS apps with vibe-coded versions, Databricks CEO Ali Ghodsi believes. But it could give rise to competitors.

title: ChatGPT rolls out ads
summary: OpenAI faced a backlash late last year when it tested app suggestions that looked like unwanted ads. Still, the AI company needs to generate revenue from its popular chatbot to cover the costs of developing its technology and growing the business.

title: Musk's Massive Space-Based Data Center: Super Scale or Sheer Folly?
summary: The concept of orbital data centers is 'conceivable,' say some analysts. But SpaceX's plan to deploy space-based data centers underpinned by a staggering 1 million satellites faces massive technical, operational, and financial challenges.

title: Anthropic closes in on $20B round
summary: The company raised $13 billion in equity funding just five months ago, but intense competition between frontier labs and the ongoing cost of compute have made them eager to raise as quickly as possible.

title: Ex-Googlers are building infrastructure to help companies understand their video data
summary: Founded by former Google Japan leaders, InfiniMind is building enterprise AI to turn vast, unused video archives into searchable, actionable business intelligence.

summary: Voltage ride-through helps data centers withstand power disturbances, ensuring resilience and minimizing downtime in an unstable energy landscape.

title: AI Infrastructure Financing Enters a New Era: What Execs Need to Know
summary: AI infrastructure financing is evolving rapidly, requiring CFOs to rethink strategies for scaling compute and capital efficiency, writes Riley Thompson.
